intro: Spiesia macrosema, commonly known as the large-seeded spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with a rough texture and prominent veins. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. Spiesia macrosema is often found in moist, disturbed soils in grasslands and forest edges.
